description: The baremetal state "DELETED" doesn't actually indicate that something was deleted, merely that a node is powered off. This misnomer is confusing when reading the code, and should be cleaned up.
title: baremetal state DELETED is misnamed

comments.content: The baremetal state "DELETED" doesn't actually indicate that something was deleted, merely that a node is powered off. This misnomer is confusing when reading the code, and should be cleaned up.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~devananda

comments.content:
